# updown_status_page (Resource)

`updown_status_page` defines a status page

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Public status page
resource "updown_status_page" "public" {
  name        = "My Services Status"
  description = "Public status page for all monitored services"
  visibility  = "public"

  checks = [
    updown_check.website.id,
    updown_check.api.id,
  ]
}

# Protected status page with access key
resource "updown_status_page" "protected" {
  name        = "Internal Services"
  description = "Protected status page for internal services"
  visibility  = "protected"
  access_key  = "my-secret-access-key"

  checks = [
    updown_check.internal_api.id,
  ]
}

# Private status page
resource "updown_status_page" "private" {
  name       = "Private Infrastructure"
  visibility = "private"

  checks = [
    updown_check.database.id,
    updown_check.cache.id,
  ]
}
```

## Schema

### Required

- `checks` (List of String) List of checks to show in the page (order is respected).

### Optional

- `access_key` (String, Sensitive) Access key for protected pages (defaults to a random string if unset).
- `description` (String) Description text (displayed below the name, supports newlines and links).
- `name` (String) Name of the status page.
- `visibility` (String) Page visibility: 'public', 'protected', or 'private'. Default: `public`.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `url` (String) The URL of the status page.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
terraform import updown_status_page.example <status_page_token>
```
